There were many teens staying at the motel traveling with teams and as parents of teens we know even the best behaved kids are noisy. But every guest and every employee at this motel was so kind and respectful. I do agree that the pool could be open just a bit later and we didnt have a coffee maker in our room which would have been nice. There was fresh coffee right downstairs though.. so we survived! We asked our teen children if they wanted to stay there again or if they would rather stay closer to the boardwalk and they agreed that the Sea Hawk was just what we wanted in a stay.It was only a quick walk to the ocean and there was mini golf right across the street too. We are already talking about going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jalenzurismom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sea Hawk for a weekend basketball tournament in June. I was a little worried because the price was so cheap, and you know. . you get what you paid for. But in this case what a bargain!! The rooms were incredibly clean. Immaculately clean. The rooms were very spacious, and they all had balconies that faced the main street. It was also right across the street from the gym where we played our games. Good restaurants were all within walking distance or a very short drive. I was more than pleased with our stay there. The only two things I would change would be. .. . a laundry room, which was very inconvenient seeing as how we were there for a basketball tournament with 4 sweaty boys that had to have their uniforms washed nightly, AND, that the pool would stay open longer. It was right outside the hotel office so it could be easily policed, but they closed at 8pm. Sometimes the kids wanted to swim at like 8:30 or 9pm and us parents wanted to sit around the pool and watch them and relax and we couldn't. Other than that, it was great! A short walk back to the beach and far enough away from the hustle and bustle on the other end of town. Desk staff was awesome too. Very personable and funny.

Reviews.Title: “Great place considering price/location”
Reviews.Author: Nittfan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay @ the SeaHawk; we stayed July 19th & 20th. This hotel is a good deal. The location is right on Ocean Hwy. so it is a bit of a noisy location (most people would have time relaxing at the pool, although the pool is clean and well kept) I was very surprised that the rooms seem well sound proofed and with the air conditioner on I heard very little noise overnight. This is definitely an older hotel but the owners and the staff have evident pride in the place and the management/staff are nice/friendly. The rooms are very, VERY clean. The bathroom was immaculate. I believe that the litmus test for hotel rooms is the shower curtain. At the bottom, inside edge of the shower curtain is where you can tell how much time the cleaning staff spends cleaning the room. This shower stall appeared NEW and the shower curtain was spotless! There were absolutely NO specks of dirt or cobwebs anywhere in that bathroom. We stayed on the 4th floor (room #450) and it appeared that the bathroom had been renovated (new "bathfitter" shower insert, new convex shower curtain rod and massager type shower head). Anyway, maybe we just lucked out and got a nice room. Another thing to note is that the bedspreads and bedding were quite nice. Pastel peach sheets (not the typical white), VERY clean and everyday when I saw the housekeepers they had a huge pile of clean bedspreads on a cart; they must wash the bedspreads on every check-out which I think is unusual for this "class" of hotel. Other noteworthy considerations: the hotel is only 1 & 1/2 SHORT blocks walk to the beach. They have complimentary coffee in the office. There is a "Doughroller" (pizza, pasta and breakfast) right across the street. There is a Dairy Queen right across the street. There is a 7-Eleven type store about 6 blocks away on the opposite side of the street. The "famous" Green Turtle bar & grill is about 10 blocks away across the street and I guess you could walk to it if you wanted. The bus stops right in front of the hotel. Overall, a VERY good deal for the money if you keep in mind that TripAdvisor is supposed to be rating the VALUE of what you get for what you pay; it is NOT to be compared to AAA ratings, Michelen awards, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanbreeze400
Reviews.Content: Great Motel. Very clean, with a friendly staff, and close to the beach. Couldnt ask for a better place. We had a full size refridge and a 4 burner stove which made meals easy with 4 children. There was also a McDonalds, and the Dough Roller within walking distance. There is also a Food Lion a few blocks away for anyone who needs to purchase groceries while on vacation. Very peaceful and quiet at night. No problems what so ever. Check in and out was very easy and done very quickly. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tt0704
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Sea Hawk Motel (July 11 through July 13). I have stayed at other hotels in Ocean City but I felt this hotel provided the best value for the price. I stayed at the motel for a rate of $164 plus a small extra fee since we had 3 people in our party. We stayed on the 4th floor since the rooms were cheaper. The room was clean and updated. Obviously, the rooms are not equilvant to a Hilton or a Marriott but the room was still very nice. I enjoyed sitting on the lounge chairs at the pool. The pool had pretty potted flowers surrounding it which I thought was a nice touch. The beach was a short walk from the hotel. There were several good places within walking distance to grap breakfast and lunch at such as WaWa, Dairy Queen and Subway. After we checked out on Sunday, we were able to utilize the small bathroom in the evening to change our clothes and clean up before heading home. Overall, the hotel was nice and I don't feel like I broke the bank by staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Sea Hawk Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 12410 Coastal Highway, 124th St Oceanside, Ocean City, MD 21842
